text: Joseph Thomas Maras (January 19, 1916 – September 17, 1990) was an American football player and coach. He played for three seasons for the Pittsburgh Steelers organization of the National Football League (NFL) from 1938 to 1940. Maras served as the head football coach at Union University in Schenectady, New York from 1960 to 1963, compiling a record of 8–23–1. He played college football at Duquesne University in Pittsburgh and was selected in the tenth round of the 1938 NFL Draft by the Cleveland Rams. ==Head coaching record== ==References== ==External links== * * Category:1916 births Category:1990 deaths Category:American football centers Category:Columbia Lions football coaches Category:Duquesne Dukes football players Category:Pittsburgh Steelers players Category:Union Dutchmen football coaches Category:Junior college football players in the United States Category:Sportspeople from Hibbing, Minnesota Category:Players of American football from Minnesota
title: Joseph T. Maras
